elements.title: Stonewall Inn (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after the original Stonewall Inn (modern building pictured) closed in 1969, its space was used by a bagel shop, a Chinese restaurant, and a clothing store?

elements.title: Shane Rawley (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that baseball player Shane Rawley has published a novel?

elements.title: Where the Angels Fall (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Cat Empire's 2023 album Where the Angels Fall features contributions from 75 musicians and 49 instruments?

elements.title: Sara Houcke (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Sara Houcke began performing in circuses at the age of two as a child clown?

elements.title: a man was denaturalized and deported from the United States (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a man was denaturalized and deported from the United States for working at a Nazi death camp, despite the courts never holding that he did it willingly?

elements.title: Joy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Joy was the sole survivor of the Romanov family's execution?

elements.title: Black Sheep Radio (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Black Sheep Radio dedicated its first day of programming to a fallen pirate?

elements.title: The Penguin History of Modern China (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that The Penguin History of Modern China profiled the Christian General, whose army moved to the beat of "Hark! The Herald Angels Sing"?

elements.title: Great Alaskan Lumberjack Show (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in the Great Alaskan Lumberjack Show, the performers scale a 50-foot (15 m) tree and then free fall?
